dialogues.text: If you say there's no monster, then switch rooms with me.

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: Switch rooms with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--you sleep in Eric's room and he sleeps in your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just want my room.

dialogues.text: Nuh-uh...I want you to prove me wrong.  I dare you to switch rooms.

dialogues.text: (advising Eric)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double dare him.

dialogues.text: (certain that this is the clincher)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubledare you to switch rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: The door, propelled by a kick, slams open.  The kick leav large scuff mark.  Brian plods in, sets down a large wick laundry basket.  Eric holds his own covers in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan)

dialogues.text: Pebbles click-clatter off the window.  Eric goes over and the sash.

dialogues.text: Todd, holding a sleeping bag, stands in a spill of moonli

dialogues.text: Hey Todd!  Good thing you made it-- (louder, for Brian's benefit)

dialogues.text: I think he's gonna bail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna let Todd in.

dialogues.text: Hold on. (addressing them both)

dialogues.text: Do either of you have the good scissors?  They're missing again.

dialogues.text: Eric's eyes widen.  He looks at the bed, then back at Bri significantly.  Brian grimaces, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.text: Well, if you run across them, put them back where they belong.

dialogues.text: Eric nods and takes off.  Brian turns back to the watch. steps forward, watches over Brian's shoulder.

dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE WATCH as Brian, using a jeweler's screwdrive tightens a mechanism.  He releases a tiny lever.  Minute spin; ticking can be heard, distinct from the soft whirri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it running!

dialogues.text: Brian grins as Glen picks up the watch, examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa'd be happy.  You have his mechanical touch.  It must skip a generation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you, Brian...what you're doing here is nice-- (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLEN (Cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: switching rooms with your brother, so he won't be scared. (beat)

dialogues.text: I'm counting on you to see this through.  No night frights.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Todd climb the stairs into Brian's room, intimid but pleased.  Todd's shoes thunder on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric surveys the disassembled stuff on Brian's worktable. reaches for an electric train--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian steps forward, takes the train, sets it back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can use the bed, and you can walk from the bed to the door and back, and that's it.

dialogues.text: You can touch my light--but only to turn it off. (beat)

dialogues.text: And no fart contests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stops in the doorway, stares at the bed.  In a deci move he turns out the light, forces himself to walk calml the bed and sit on the edge.  He jerks his legs up, lies

dialogues.text: Brian looks at it, then pulls it in a bit.  He lies back, his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as derisively as he can manage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...monsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, smoothly, as if with a mind of its own, the foot back into the safety of the covers.

dialogues.text: The waxing moon shines brightly.  Brian comes awake with start.  He tilts his head, listening--muffled, indistinct of laughter can be heard, fading quickly to silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puzzled, frowning, Brian starts to swing a leg out of bed stops--thinks--then pushes the covers away from him until touch the floor, covering the space beneath the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long step, and Brian is safely in the middle of the roo goes to the door, keeping an eye on the bed, unable to se beneath it--the covers block his view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sidles out of the door, listens--he hears a muffled and moves silently toward it, to the vent in the wall by attic stairs.  The voice becomes clearer as he nears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low and scary-like)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she goes out, and five minutes go by, then ten... (Brian reaches the vent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the girl's waiting for her roommate to get back, and she's getting real scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vent is flush to the floor.  Todd is in his mummy bag his face visible, sitting across from Eric.  The Tensor l the campfire between the two, the gooseneck bent down so the lip of the shade nearly touches the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low and scary-like)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --oh, yeah, the room's on the second floor--so she's waiting, and suddenly, from outside, she hears 'thump-THUMP...thump-THUMP.' So she gets real brave and she sneaks over to the door and she hears it again: 'thump- THUMP...thump-THUMP!'

dialogues.text: Brian raises one eyebrow, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so she opens the door and she screams 'cause she sees her roommate coming up the stairs-- only the ax-man cut off all her arms and legs and she's draggin' herself up by her chin 'thump- THUMP...thump-THUMP!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd, in his mummy bag, writhes on the floor, impressivel depicting the predicament of the limbless roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian shakes his head, disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happened to a girl a friend of my cousin knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian thinks.  He hits the riser in front of him with the of his hand: 'thump-THUMP...thump- THUMP.' All sound from upstairs ceases.  Brian grins darkly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian comes through the door--and stops dead in his track

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedcovers have been thrown all the way back, away fro floor, onto the mattress--they lie in a long pile against wall.  Brian stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black inkiness of the under-the-bed gapes at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian lowers himself into a half-stoop, half-crouch, peer into the darkness.  Is there something there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian throws a look at the desk--the stand is empty; his pocketwatch is gone.  Brian's eyes go wide.  He looks-- a it under the bed, just on the edge of the shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian reaches his hand up along the door frame to the lig switch.  He flips the switch--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and A MONSTROUS, HORRIFIC, CHILLING HOWL comes from right him.  Brian spins in the still-dark room.  A blue glow fl behind the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd jumps back from the stairs, bumping into Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping back) (panicked; a hiss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (another step back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. (futilely optimistic that Eric will do it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.text: Brian forces himself toward the blue glow and noise.  He for the knob, yanks the door back, stares into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the family's 25" diagonal television set, sitting on it plugged into the switched socket, tuned to an SCTV rerun featuring Count Floyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian snaps off the light switch (shutting off the set) a whirls, ducking to look under-the-bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The watch chain becomes taut--the watch is pulled smoothl of view, into the deep shadows under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Brian, a cold sweat on his forehead, all doubt d from his face: Eric was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian darts his head out; a light shines from beneath his parents' door.  Brian's eyes go wide with anticipatory dr and then the light goes out.  Brian slumps, relieved, the a look back over his shoulder into the room--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian tilts the TV set down onto the throw rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television set slides heavily down the hall atop the rug pulled by Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian grapples with the set, controlling its roll one ste time, top-to-side-to-bottom-to-side, down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian pushes the set into place.  He adjusts it slightly. gaze-- almost against his will--is drawn back up to the c in the direction of Eric's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Brian, asleep but not comfortably so.  A hand re grabs Brian's shoulder, shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Brian!  You okay?

dialogues.text: Brian starts awake--for a moment really scared.  Then he himself.  He has spent the night on the couch, using a dr as a blanket; also in the room are paint cans, rollers, a ladder.

dialogues.text: Eric and Todd stand over Brian, gloating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this means we get our money back.

dialogues.text: What happened?  Did the monster come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it cut out his tongue.

dialogues.text: That's cats.

dialogues.text: No, they just get it.  Monsters cut 'em out and wear 'em on a necklace.

dialogues.text: Brian?  Are you awake?

dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.text: Eric asked me to give this to you.

dialogues.text: (slightly questioning)

dialogues.text: He said that tonight, he wanted you to have it.

dialogues.text: Brian lets this go by.  Holly smiles, goes to the door.

dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.text: She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like he's saying goodbye)

dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.text: (puzzled, but pleased)

dialogues.text: I love you, too.

dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Glen as his eyes track from one corner of the ro another, his expression going from tired annoyance to sho disbelief to wide-awake anger.  He focuses on

dialogues.text: Christ, Brian--I was counting on you... (beat)

dialogues.text: I give up.

dialogues.text: Wait a minute!  I...there is--

dialogues.text: He kicks the clothes.  Unseen by Glen, two folds in the c open like eyelids and stare up hatefully.  Brian's eyes w

dialogues.text: Brian slams the laundry basket over the clothes pile, thr body on top of it.  The basket forces itself up off the f Brian is pitched hard, heels-over-head, to the ground.

dialogues.text: (gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, time out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian pauses...then sees that the monster is furtively ed toward the bed.  Brian glances out the window.  He sees t lighting sky, smiles.  He steps in front of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Why don't we just wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster recovers amazingly fast, growls and feints, r Brian out of the way with a shoulder.  He makes it to the just as the sun edges over the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster slips his fingers in under the bed frame and up.  His fingers pass through the box-spring and mattress hands have become two-dimensional, intangible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian jumps onto the mattress.  The monster panics.  Bria levers the stick between the bed and the monster, pries h away.  The monster tries to move, but his now-intangible have no purchase.  He falls, hands inches from the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gradient effect, beginning at the monster's fingertips, him from yellow to gray to black, transforming him into h shadow.  Brian stares as the arms and legs flatten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dying.  The sunlight-- you're a vampire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puh-leez.  No such thing...as vampires...Gotta get back under the bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  You wrecked my bike.  You stole my watch.  You been pulling stuff, trying to get me in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt; defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sucks on his lower lip, thinking.  He looks toward window.  The sun has almost cleared the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you never did anything just for a laugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice's eyes, wide and pleading, lock with Brian's.  Th gaze at each other, until finally the monster's eyelids d closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sighs at his victory turned hollow.  With both hand raises a corner of the bed, watching the monster, not at sure if it will do any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice's eyes open slightly.  His gaze flickers to the b tries to move but can't.  Straining to hold the bed up, B puts his arm around Maurice's still-solid torso and pushe into the shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian lets the bed drop.  He collapses to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the bed lifts, raising away from the floor like trapdoor.  Brian jumps back.  The monster, fully recovere quite pleased, holds the bed easily above his head with o He looks like he is standing waist deep in an inky pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gaze flickers to the window--just as the sun clears t horizon, he grins a yellow grin at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian-- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Catch ya later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disappears, the bed dropping to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the master bedroom, Glen sits at a desk covered with b a printing calculator and the check book.  Holly holds an invoice.  The tone of the argument is not harsh-- just ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's certainly the liberal solution to a problem.  Throw money at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, since I seem to be responsible for getting this place fixed up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we made the decision to live here, we knew it meant a lot of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm commuting four hours a day. Do you think I enjoy that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem to enjoy much of anything nowadays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving to shut the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's not that much to enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the hall, Brian steps out of Eric's room with the la basket.  Glen spots him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finished cleaning.  I was going back up to my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, get there and stay there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glen shuts the door.  A beat; Brian turns to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian lies on his back, wide awake, staring up into the darkness.  Suddenly, another one of Eric's screams pierce silence.  Brian starts, then frowns, a little scared.  A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from under the bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian...hey, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's eyes go a little wider.  He doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo!  Brian!  I'm back!  Why'd you switch rooms again with that whiffleball?  You know he sucks his thumb? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, I know you're up there.  I can hear you holding your breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian begins breathing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine.  Here--I brought you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thing lands on Brian's chest.  He squirms out from unde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch ya' later!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clatter from below, and then silence.  Brian gingerly p Maurice's gift, holds it up into a spill of moonlight: hi grandfather's pocketwatch.  Surprised, he looks down over side of the bed.  Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kickball game in progress.  Ronnie is on second base; B the catcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lanky red-headed girl kicks a grounder.  Ronnie rounds and heads for home.  Brian, in the baseline, waits for th throw.  Ronnie accelerates, lowers his shoulder and slams Brian, sending him sprawling in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie stands up, grins at Brian, turns toward his dugout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The throw from first rolls in. Brian picks it up.  With d aim, he hurls the ball as hard as he can, nailing Ronnie back of the head.  Ronnie stumbles, recovers, spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't hit the plate.  You're outta--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie has already launched himself at Brian, and the two down into the dust amid shouts of 'Fight!  Fight!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian gets out of the car, walks toward the house, the co man escorted to the chair--by Glen and Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know why you threw the ball at him in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mouth, Brian.  The principal said the game was over, and then you threw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ.  A new school, and more fighting.  Do you have any idea how disappointed we are in you? (he opens the front door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never going to get out of your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of pure anger crosses Brian's face as he goes insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian trudges up the stairs, to his desk.  He digs into h pocket, pulls out the pocketwatch, flips it open--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --pieces of shattered crystal rain down.  Brian is shocke crystal is gone, the casing dented...the hands still.  Th benign Sun is frozen, peeking out of the wedge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian grips the watch, fists going white-knuckled--he spi throw it against the wall, stops.  A deep breath.  He sit starts to take the watch apart, blinking back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is asleep, his head on the desk.  Just the desk lam on.  Suddenly the bulb SHATTERS, throwing the room into darkness, snapping Brian awake.  He whirls--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice stands silhouetted in moonlight, twirling a sling the elastic.  He hitches his Senators cap back on his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name's Maurice, but back home they call me 'Dead-eye.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian scrabbles for the light switch he has rigged to a b extension cords--he flips it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHT FLOODS THE ROOM: two shadeless floor lamps, super-8 lamp, mechanic's light, the overhead light; extension cor criss-cross the floor; a string of miniature Christmas li circle the room, blinking, casting colored shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice disappears.  The slingshot clatters onto the floo beside the same pile of clothes from before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like when your eyeballs get bigger when it gets darker.  If the lights go on, you turn into clothes.  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like his mouth is filled with cotton)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon--we did the man-versus- monster thing to death all ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away.  Don't bother me anymore, or Eric.  I got enough problems without you sneaking around. (beat; it registers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my name, don't wear it out. C'mon, Brian.  I gave back the watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian considers.  He flips the switch; the lights go off. Maurice re-forms into his bipedal self.  He pockets his slingshot, spies the watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--I did not return it in that condition.  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie Coleman broke it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsk.  What kind of person has no respect for other people's property?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So call your lawyer.  How'd it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you?  Ronnie smashed it, and then I got in trouble. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always get in trouble, and I don't do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get in trouble, and you don't do anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let them get away with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice pulls a pack of Lucky Strikes out of his pocket, one out, lights it one-handed from a matchbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, you've come to the right place.  I can help you.  I can get you what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blows smoke across the match, extinguishing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little greedy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  You mean--like wishes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wishes are strictly bush-league leprechaun, pal.  I'm a monster. Monsters don't do wishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do...monsters do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imparting a great secret)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits, smiling smugly.  Brian is less than enthused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on--Revenge!  You know, get back, even-up, tit-for-tat, retribution in the best Old Testament sense!  Vengeance. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian raises an eyebrow, one corner of his mouth twitchin a grin.  Maurice seizes on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  This Ronnie guy.  Big kid, slack jaw, hair like a whisk broom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sullen agreement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious chromosome damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right!  I know him!  He's in my district.  I can get him for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is starting to get into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice holds up one finger ('allow me to demonstrate'), slides beneath the bed with a flourish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie Coleman's under my bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...but under your bed is the way to under Ronnie Coleman's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aah--you won't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian--you gotta learn to trust people.  Besides, it's not like you could come with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's eyes light up.  He looks toward the bed.  The for beckons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...noooo, oh, no.  Forget it. Wrong.  Totally unprecedented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is grinning, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was joking.  It was a joke. You're not allowed down there. You could get hurt. (beat; sinister)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could strand you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian frowns, then leans toward Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't do that, 'cause I'm taking this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brandishes the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, there, Thunder--no lights. Definitely not allowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian flicks on the light, angles it toward him menacingl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Bring that along, why dontcha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hesitates, then grins tightly, every late-night Cha Bronson film of the last five years replaying in his mind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's nail that toad to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know...you're my kinda guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice lifts the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian kneels.  Looks at Maurice, dubious.  He extends his into the darkness.  It does not go through the solid floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, that's right.  We gotta go together.  Dull people can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using one hand to support the bed, Maurice grabs Brian's helps him in. Brian, tentative, expecting to contact floo startled to find none.  He loses his balance, plunges str through the shadow; from below comes a THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (a sinister smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disappears into the shadow.  The bed THWOMPS to the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian picks himself up off the ground.  He is next to a c door, at the bottom of a narrow, steep staircase that lea to the rectangle shadow of the bed.  Maurice skitters dow staircase to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian panics, searches the floor beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice dangles the flashlight from one finger.  Brian gr Maurice pulls open the door, steps out into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian peers down the hall--the ends, if any, are lost in distance.  Doors are scattered along the walls; some reac with low-set knobs; others are short; there are Dutch doo French doors and doors that hang crooked, but still shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls loom, seemingly on the verge of collapsing in o themselves.  The dark mahogany wainscotting and dark red wallpaper swallow the light from the tiny flickering gas near the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian steps into this.  His jaw is slack.  A frayed red r cuts a swath down the polished black floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice is already moving down the stairway.  He realizes isn't with him, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo!  Brian!  Let's move 'em out! We're burning nightlight, pard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian starts slowly, then hurries to catch up to Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian gasps.  The hallway has ended; they are at the bott a huge well.  Archways lead to other hallways; above, the tiers of landings running around the circumference, and m hallways.  Further up, the landings droop and twist, whol sections torn away, until there is just black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the well is a massive staircase, spirall offshoots connecting the landings.  It continues far up, standing alone, dilapidated, too impossibly high to suppo own weight--but it does.  And there, at a dizzying height ends at a small landing, at a pair of tall doors, seeming suspended in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian grabs Maurice's robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a croak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?  Oh...we go one flight up, and it's the third door on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads up the stairs.  Brian hangs onto the robe, eyes letting Maurice lead him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wrought-iron circular stairway disappears into the bed- black area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But--but Ronnie lives clear over by Lake Skopski.  How..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little smug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice climbs the stairs into the shadow, disappearing f shoulders up; Brian follows, bumps his head, unable to go through.  Maurice reaches down and pulls him up by the co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice and Brian look for all the world like two decapit heads sitting on the floor under a bed.  They whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is somebody else's house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No duh--where'd ya park the squad car, Dick Tracy?  It's Ronnie Coleman's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...bitchin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movement from above startles Brian; an ankle flops down, in front of his face.  A beat, and he reaches for it--but Maurice grabs his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait--too primitive.  Good instinct, though.  Hmm, now...what deviltry to perpetrate tonight? A banshee wail, perhaps? (he runs a scale, coughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...mm, maybe not...lessee...We gotta watch our step here.  Every night like clockwork this dingus gets up to go to the bathroom.  I almost got caught once planting cigarettes in his bookbag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time does he usually get up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice shoves his cap back, cocks an eyebrow...then grin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie snurfles awake.  Groggily, he stretches and sits u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and the sheet yanks tight, slamming Ronnie back onto th mattress, pinning his arms.  He struggles mightily, tryin get up--the sheet snaps taut and he is pinned again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice and Brian grin like madmen at each other across t bedshadow as they strain to keep Ronnie pinned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!  Dad!  Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian almost lets go of his side--but Maurice puts a hand a 'not yet' gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his most horrible voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screaming will only make it worse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie squirms half-heartedly.  The fear is numbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice nudges Brian, indicating it's his turn.  Brian sh his head 'no'; Maurice eggs him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screechy old-type voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he gets up, I get his toes. You can eat the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice looks at Brian: 'That's disgusting.' Brian shrugs was just a first attempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above, Ronnie gives up the struggle; he grimaces in humil A tear squeezes out of one eye, rolls down his cheek--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the door opens; the light goes on.  Ronnie's dad, a sol with an iron-grey brush cut, steps into the empty room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta be to work early, this better be good--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Coleman sees the wet stain on the bed sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit.  Dammit, Ron, I thought you'd whipped this bedwetting thing.  You're almost a man, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't move, Dad...I couldn't move my arms, I couldn't get up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Brian and Maurice crouch.  Brian's eyes are bright listens: so this is power.  Maurice watches Brian listeni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sounding more defeated than Ronnie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up and change your sheets. Clean yourself up.  We'll talk about this later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yes, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall stretches long and deep.  Far off, Brian and Mau cavort away.  They high-five, laugh, and continue on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Maurice's help, Brian pulls himself out from under t He looks back in at Maurice, exhilarated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, that was great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--you're a natural, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whaddaya say, Bri?  Tomorrow night.  Same bed-time?  Same bed- channel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's immediate impulse is to say 'yes,'but he stifles to give it some thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.  Me.  Moonlight.  Magic. C'mon, Brian--take a walk on the wild side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  Brian grins--and Maurice grabs his hand, shak jive-style: normal, thumb clasp, wrist clasp, slap five, tap, thumb clasp variation leading to ascending birdies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Catch ya later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie, sweating and dusty, bends to take a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful there, Ronnie.  You wouldn't want to splash any. People might think you had an...accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie straightens, murder in his eyes.  Brian leans agai wall.  Other kids, including CRAIG, wait in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I wanted any of your lip, Stevenson, I'd take it off my zipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside, to Craig)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in his permanent record.  I saw it.  Blew me away. Imagine...Ronnie Coleman--a bedwetter.  Whoa, reality check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Stevenson.  That's a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More kids gather like sharks smelling blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wets the bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His dad's very upset about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late; in the eyes of his peers, Ronnie is already gui Brian pushes away from the wall and strolls out through t crowd, saying to Craig as he goes by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him about the rubber sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids sense the kill.  Faces beam with grim pleasure, crowding in, obscuring Brian as he saunters off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubber sheets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian smiles and does not look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian waits, impatient.  He jiggles his foot out over the of the bed, bait for Maurice.  Finally, Maurice appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice!  It was great!  He was dying out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool your jets, okay?  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian rushes out ahead of Maurice--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and collides with BILLY, a monster wearing crossed toy gunbelts.  Billy drops a box, and dozens of doll heads, a legs--Barbies, G.I.Joes, Baby Tears--spill out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Barbie-head comes to rest near Maurice's foot.  He pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  You stupid..!  That's mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy grabs the head from Maurice, and scurries around th picking up the parts.  Maurice ushers Brian away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her science project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice swings open the door, draws back the curtain-- li pours out--he leaps away with a shriek, dropping the curt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice looks down at his hand.  It is shadow-like, slowl reverting to normal.  Brian has seen all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice, royally pissed off, strides to the box, fumbles behind it, yanks out the plug.  He leans into the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks away from him, back at Kiersten.  A beat, and screen maleficent chuckle from Maurice, and then Maurice at Brian's side.  He grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon, let's go, we've all seen a girl before.  Let's move it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll find out, you'll love it, c'mon, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hustles Brian under the bed.  Maurice pauses to look a Kiersten himself.  He makes a 'not bad' expression, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian breezes through the door...then slows.  At one of t tables are MR. FINN, Kiersten, several other students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks closer.  On the table is Kiersten's plant-box the night-blooming cereus--now planted upside down, the r sticking out.  Kiersten holds the flip-book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have this--you can see how it used to look--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to riffle it, but it is now a solid brick.  It out of her hand.  Kids giggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you at least have your report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it, but my dog chewed it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Finn frowns at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the students laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiersten, you know no report means a zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hangs his head, turns away slowly; there is no joy expression at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooooh...busted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd is under the worktable.  Eric crouches, trying to se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd backs out from under the worktable holding a dinosau and a calculator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster from under the bed! It's dragging Brian away at night. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric inspects Todd's discovery.  It is a fourteen inch-lo ball smear that could be anything from a fish to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a footprINT.  It stepped in all that dust under there and left a track. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm figuring out how big it is. By measuring the length of the footprint and the impression depth, then using the... (checks book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...'cube square' law--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calculating the final number)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a seven-foot-eight, three hundred-and-seventeen pound Troll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and it fits under the bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd looks at the display.  New calculations may be in or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is the last to the table, and late--the others have started to dig in. As he sits, Holly gets a good look at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you look... (the word escapes her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches over, feels his forehead.  Brian shies away, to pile food onto his plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she examines him critically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thin as a rail.  You need to eat more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric frowns at Brian's overflowing plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look...peaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Peaked.' What is 'peaked'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother used to say it-- and he looks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a plate for my salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scoots his chair back from the table, heads for the ki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a new shirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks big on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks down at it, shrugs, heads into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian opens a cupboard, reaches for a plate--and can't re shelf.  He is puzzled.  He reaches up, slower-- his finge an inch short of the plates.  He goes up on tip-toe and t them.  He lowers himself off tip-toe, looking worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian rummages through his dresser.  He pulls out a ruler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian runs his finger up the family growth chart, finds t for his twelfth birthday.  He turns, stands with his back against the door.  He levels the ruler on top of his head Holding it steady, he slips out from beneath it to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ruler is a full inch below where it was on his last birthday.  Brian stares unbelieving at the chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian paces the room, waiting.  He crouches beside the be leans forward and extends a hand toward the shadow-- and hand goes through.  He yanks it back like its been scalde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian examines his hand wonderingly.  He regards the shad then again extends his hand toward it.  The hand passes t and Brian keeps putting his arm in, up to the elbow.  Sud his arm is jerked and his face hits the mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian wrenches his arm out, dragging Maurice, who is grip Brian's wrist, part-way out through the shadow.  Maurice again, and this time Brian goes into the shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as Brian and Maurice catch themselves halfway down the Brian is a little amazed, but Maurice is ebullient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A natural!  A one-hundred percent, no holds-barred, died-in-the-wool, no-assembly-required natural!  I knew you had it in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks at him, realization coming slowly to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?  Geez, I thought I caught on quick-- but you!  You're already moving through shadows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not--you pulled me through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this false modesty?  You put your hand through all on your own. (he salutes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian...It is an honor to have you on our side.  Now-- let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scampers down to the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice looks back up at Brian, halfway down the stairs, shadow exit visible above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accusingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to be normal?  I'm going to end up like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, normal's a relative term, but...Yeah.  Where do you think monsters come from?  Ugly storks? No-- they were all kids once, just like you--and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The full weight of this hits Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm turning into a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitchin', huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian springs toward the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stops.  He looks angrily down at Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've told me, Maurice! I thought you were my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...slipped my mind.  Okay-- listen.  You're upset.  That's understandable.  I remember when I found out. (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAURICE (Cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went totally batshit.  But--look where I am today. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take some time, Bri.  Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian turns away from his words--looks up at the shadow. swallows, extends his hand.  It goes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to talk it over, well... (significantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --just drop in anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian glares down at him, then spins--and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all, what are friends for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice folds his arms, slumps back against the wall.  Sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian lies in bed fuming, his arms crossed.  He stares an up at the ceiling.  With a decisive jerk, he rolls over, from the under-the-bed, toward the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian has fallen asleep.  He is shaken by the shoulder. pulls his covers around him.  The gentle shaking continue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Brian.  Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sits up sleepily.  Glen leans over him.  Eric, in h pajamas, stands in the stairwell, leaning on a railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly sits at the table.  Brian warily takes his seat.  G Eric are already sitting, Eric still yawning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly reaches across the table and squeezes Eric's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wanted to talk to you two because...your father and I have come to a decision, and it affects all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We feel you're grown up enough to understand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is immediately suspicious.  Eric looks suddenly wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father and I have decided to separate for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's face is frozen--but his eyes show understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little foggy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A business trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Can't you see?  They're getting a divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric looks away from him quickly, to his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're not getting a divorce. We're going to try to work things out, but we have to be apart for a while.  It's just a trial separation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what you do before you get a divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of that, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting a divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Dad's not leaving.  Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, listen to me.  I'm going to live in the city for a while.  It might--I hope--we hope it won't be for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Eric.  I do.  And it would be a big help if I knew I could count on the two of you to understand--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be good!  I promise I'll be better-- you won't have to go live in the city.  I swear to God, I'll be better.  Brian too-- he'll stop being bad, he promises.  Right? Promise, Brian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks away, ignoring Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian--promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, it's not your fault, or Brian's fault--or anybody's fault. Sometimes two people--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian pushes his chair back, stands, heads for the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian--it's not your fault--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Brian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian turns back, no emotion in his eyes for his crying b his mother, his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, dad.  Don't worry about me. I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glen gives Brian a hard look, nods.  Brian turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian puts his watch-care paraphernalia into his bookbag, including the watchstand.  He crouches by the bed, puts o into the shadow--still amazed he can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a last look around--and the mask cracks.  For a he looks as if he is going to cry.  The look becomes one determination; he slips under the bed, and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven monsters play what looks like a street craps game. Cigarette smoke fills the air; Maurice kneels for his tur monsters chatter for or against him, depending on their b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice fires into the chalk circle, nailing the aimed-at eye.  The monsters groan and cheer; money changes hands. appears in the doorway, spreads his arms wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice leaps up and lets out a WHOOP--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice and Brian make slow progress as a drunken two per conga line.  Maurice wears a beerhelmet, sucking from the plastic straw that hangs near his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian carries a teddybear and a plastic bag filled with w and two live goldfish.  In the other hand he carries a be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Let's go scare Ronnie some more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  Let's steal all his clothes so he'll have to go to school naked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  Let's nail all his furniture to the ceiling!  So he'll wake up upside-down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pair appear beneath Ronnie's bed.  Maurice scrambles and a baseball bat slams down dangerously close to his he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie, crouched on his bed, takes another cut at Maurice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --who squirms, barely avoids the blow, grabs Brian--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two tumble down, THUDDING to the floor in a tangle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We...we gotta go get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inspired)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Let's--not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice considers this, then grins.  The two sit in the h snickers turning to belly laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie crouches on the bed, tense, a baseball bat held at in each hand, prepared to wait all night.  He cocks his h From far away, is that the sound of laughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Maurice, still chuckling, use each other for su as they struggle to their feet.  Spike barrels around the corner, red-faced--he stops right in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night light...at Guberman's...burned out...party!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rockets off.  Maurice grabs Brian by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nightlight at the Guberman's is burned out!  PARTY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A queue of monsters, fidgeting, anticipating, goes up the to the shadow.  Maurice escorts Brian through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming through!  New guy!  Excuse me, pardon me, coming through! (aside, to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick with me kid--I know the doorman. (back to business)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the way!  Yeah, you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baby in Dr. Dentons sleeps.  Six monsters stand around crib-- a macabre variation on adults cooing over a newbor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice rises up from beneath the crib.  Brian appears ov Maurice's shoulder, grinning--until he sees the baby.  Ma gestures magnanimously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...it's just a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice looks uncomfortably at the other monsters, who ex looks.  A murmur of 'who's the wimp?' is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  So?  Look, Bri--we can't have this new generation growing up not believing in monsters. Fear is an important character builder.  It's our duty: break 'em when they're young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Let's go watch Kiersten sleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of the corner of his mouth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, you're embarrassing me. (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'head, Bri--just give it a good scare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glowers at Brian, then gestures sharply, prompting him Brian leans forward hesitantly.  The monsters lean forwar anticipating.  Brian wiggles his fingers at the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo.  Boo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monsters are disappointed.  Some 'tsk.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you--the toothfairy? Like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice makes a horrible face, climbs halfway into the cr waking the baby with really gross slurping sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby's eyes go wide; he cries.  The other monsters jo The kid really bawls.  Brian doesn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! (yanks Maurice back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monsters stare at him, their disgust and anger becomi palpable.  Brian spins, runs to the door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and yanks it open.  LIGHT spills into the room from the hallway-- the monsters transform--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so does Brian's arm--it transforms into a sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stares in horror at his arm.  He hurls himself at t light switch, shuts it off, runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian rushes out the door of the house, to the sidewalk-- slows.  Stops.  He has no idea where he is.  He looks aro spots a street sign.  He gets his bearings, turns, and wa away, a tiny lone figure on a long empty street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun breaks the horizon.  Brian, terrified, looks at h but they do not change.  He lets out a deep breath.  He s at the sun, pulls out his sunglasses...looks at them.  He them into the gutter, where one lens shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, dressed, lies across the bed, head hanging off, eye closed.  Todd bursts in, rushes over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited; low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured it out.  I know what the monster is doing with Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric gives no response; Todd plows on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a body snatcher.  See, it's taking over Brian and using his body to prepare the way for the invasion force!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel like playing, Todd. I don't feel good.  I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric turns his head away.  Todd looks at him, crestfallen leaves slowly, watching Eric the whole way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sits on his bed, light switch in hand.  He checks o side of the bed; nothing.  He pulls his knees up, waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wraith-like, Maurice slips into the room.  He stands with fists on his hips, staring at Brian--who starts, looks up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going.  I don't want to live down there.  I don't want to be-- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to be what?  Go ahead, say it.  You don't want to be like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not going. (he looks away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't want me to be your friend.  You just wanted me to turn into a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not liking the accusation, 'cause it's pretty accurate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't make somebody do something they really don't wanna do.  Now, c'mon--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice grabs Brian by the arm; Brian pulls away.  He gra light switch.  Maurice leaps for his arm--Brian snaps on lights, and Maurice transforms into clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian catches his breath.  He reaches into the clothes, i the slapping sleeves.  Brian's hand emerges from the pock the robe with Maurice's matches.  The sleeves freeze, dro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian tears a match from the packet.  He holds it to the striking surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.  Don't come back here.  Do you understand? (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  Brian strikes the match.  The clothes shrink ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me do this.  Just promise to leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long pause) (muffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts off the lights.  The match illumines his face; M re-forms, and moves toward Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a sneer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trusted me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice, about to mock him, pulls up short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ducking his head, he dives past Brian into the under-the- The match burns down; Brian drops it; the room goes black

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand covers Eric's mouth gently.  He snaps awake, cries

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (removing his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh--quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez--I thought you were the monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian swallows this without comment.  He holds the flashl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, take this.  If you hear anything, turn it on-- and yell-- even if it's only a pile of clothes.  Especially if it's a pile of clothes.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm not going to.  You're trying to scare me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--I'm not--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised to be good.  I'm not going to have any more nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric won't take the flashlight.  Brian sets it on the bed pauses in the doorway, turns on the lights, and then he g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric gets out of bed, and shuts off the lights.  He climb under the covers.  He picks up the flashlight.  He clicks off, on again.  Dead batteries.  No light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the flashlight beside the bed, rolls over angril

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice backs away from Snik, who looms over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did bad, Maurice.  Bad for morale.  If he rabbits, others will, too. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to take your medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
